humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " speaking " and " sending ", the original meaning is to blame and condemn. "Shuowen": "Quick questions. From words, to speak out." "Zhuangzi·Tianxia": "Only communicate with the spirit of heaven and earth without being obsessed with all things, not condemning right and wrong, in order to deal with the world." Cheng Xuanying Shu: "Condemn, condemn."

" Condemnation " can refer to officials being demoted or banished. Tang Wei Sili's "Fenghe Zhang Yuezhou Wang Tanzhou Poems": "To be together with Zhang Shijun from Yuezhou, Tanzhou's capital governor Xiong is a joint official, and then he inherits the imperial condemnation and separates his own things."

" Condemnation " also means sin and fault. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty·Cai Yong Biography": "Every time the edict is written, each of the hundreds of officials will seal the affairs. They want to condemn them with political reforms, and eliminate the evil and bring good luck.
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " words " and " send ", the original meaning is to blame and condemn.
humanum_full_description:
從「言」，「遣」聲，本義為責問、譴責。《說文》：「謫問也。从言，遣聲。」 《莊子‧天下》：「獨與天地精神往來而不敖倪於萬物，不譴是非，以與世俗處。」成玄英疏：「譴，責也。」

　　「譴」可指官吏被貶降或謫戍。唐韋嗣立〈奉和張岳州王潭州別詩〉：「予昔忝省閤，與岳州張使君說、潭州王都督熊同官聯事，後承朝譴，各自東西。」

　　「譴」也表示罪、過錯。《後漢書‧蔡邕傳》：「詔書每下，百官各上封事，欲以改政思譴，除凶致吉。」
